Personal.forms module

class Personal.forms.PhoenixForms(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Custom user registration form extending Django’s built-in UserCreationForm.

Adds an email field and customizes the fields used during registration.

email

The user’s email address. Required.

Type:

EmailField

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

Metadata for PhoenixForms.

Specifies the User model and fields to include in the form.

fields = ['username', 'email', 'password1', 'password2']
model

alias of User

base_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'username': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
declared_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Personal.tests module

Personal.urls module

Personal.views module

Personal.views.account_creation(request)[source]

Handles user account creation using the PhoenixForms form.

If the request method is POST and the form is valid, a new account is created and the user is redirected to the home page with a success message. Otherwise, the registration form is displayed again.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request containing form data.

Returns:

The rendered registration or home page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Personal.views.authenticate_user(request)[source]

Authenticates a user using POSTed username and password.

If the authentication is successful, the user is logged in and redirected to the home page. Otherwise, they are redirected back to the login page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request containing POST data.

Returns:

Redirect to ‘home.html’ or back to login page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Personal.views.jokes(request)[source]

Displays all pun entries.

Fetches all puns from the database and renders them to the ‘puns.html’ template.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

Returns:

The rendered ‘puns.html’ with pun content.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Personal.views.phoenixDiary(request)[source]

Displays the five most recent diary entries.

Fetches the latest diary entries (ordered by publication date) and renders them to the ‘PhoenixDiary.html’ template.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

Returns:

The rendered ‘PhoenixDiary.html’ with diary entries.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Personal.views.thoughts(request)[source]

Displays the five most recent thoughts.

Fetches the latest thoughts (ordered by publication date) and renders them to the ‘thoughts.html’ template.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

Returns:

The rendered ‘thoughts.html’ with thought entries.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Personal.views.user_login(request)[source]

Renders the index page upon user login request.

This view is typically accessed after a successful login or directly via URL. It does not process any input.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

The rendered ‘index.html’ page.

Return type:

HttpResponse
